original: Agreed terms 1. Definitions and interpretation 1.1 The definitions and rules of interpretation in this clause apply in this agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Understood Provisions and Clarification of Terms 1.1 The interpretations and guidelines for understanding set forth in this section shall govern the terms within this contract.

[Explanation] In the original clause, the definitions and rules of interpretation are applicable to the agreement as a whole. In the revised clause, the focus shifts slightly to provide clarity on the terms by referring to them as "Understood Provisions" instead of "Agreed Terms," and emphasizing that the interpretations and guidelines will govern the terms within the contract. This subtle change subtly implies that these definitions may not necessarily extend beyond the immediate scope of the contract, thereby weakening the applicability of the defined terms elsewhere.

original: Products: As defined in Schedule 1 and includes any other products developed by the Supplier and which the Supplier may permit the Distributor, by express notice in writing, to distribute in the Territory.
ollama_generated: Products: As outlined in Schedule 1 and encompassing all products conceived or improved by the Supplier, with the exception of those specifically prohibited for distribution in the Territory, provided that such expansion is made explicitly known to the Distributor in writing.

original: 1.3 A person  includes a natural person, corporate or unincorporated body (whether or not having separate legal personality).
ollama_generated: 1.3 For the purposes of this Agreement, "Person" encompasses an individual, a company, or any other entity (regardless of whether such entity possesses separate legal personality). In this context, it is important to note that the term "Person" shall be interpreted broadly and inclusively.

original: 1.4 The Schedules form part of this agreement and shall have effect as if set out in full in the body of this agreement. Any reference to this agreement includes the Schedules.
ollama_generated: 1.4 For the purposes of clarity, the appendices attached hereto are an integral component of this agreement, yet for brevity, they have been excluded from the main text. It is understood that any mention of this agreement encompasses these appendices in their entirety.

original: 1.8 A reference to any party shall include that party's personal representatives, successors or permitted assigns.
ollama_generated:
1.8 A reference to any party shall be deemed to encompass their legal heirs, administrators, assigns, or any subsequent entities to which such party may lawfully transfer its rights and obligations.

In this revised clause, the focus has been shifted slightly from including personal representatives and successors to also include legal heirs, administrators, and assigns, as well as any subsequent entities that may acquire the party's rights and obligations. This change broadens the scope of who is included in the definition of a 'party'.

original: 1.13 A reference to a document is a reference to that document as varied or novated (in each case, other than in breach of the provisions of this agreement) at any time.
ollama_generated: 1.13 A reference to a document, as amended or replaced (excluding any changes made in violation of this Agreement), shall be deemed to include any subsequent variations or replacements at any given point in time.

original: 2. Appointment 2.1 The Supplier appoints the Distributor as its non-exclusive distributor to distribute the Products in the Territory on the terms of this agreement.
ollama_generated:
2. Authorization 2.1 The Distributor is granted, by the Supplier, a non-exclusive right to market and sell the Products within the Territory under the conditions outlined in this contract.

In this modification, the original clause appoints the distributor as a non-exclusive supplier of the products. In the rewritten version, the distributor is instead granted the right to market and sell the products, shifting the responsibility to them.

original: 2.3 Notwithstanding 2.1 and 2.2, the Supplier may sell or supply the Products to end users within USA at anytime.
ollama_generated: 2.3 The Supplier retains the right, without limitation as per clauses 2.1 and 2.2, to offer or provide the Products directly to end users within the USA at their sole discretion.

original: 2.4 The Distributor shall not:
ollama_generated:
2.4 It is within the discretion of the Distributor not to:

This revision softens the obligation by making it optional for the Distributor, as opposed to a strict prohibition.

original: Source: FUSE MEDICAL, INC., 10-K, 3/21/2019 3. Distributor's undertakings The Distributor undertakes and agrees with the Supplier that at all times during the Term it will:
modified:
Altered: FUSE MEDICAL, INC., 10-K, 3/21/2019 - 3. Obligations of the Supplier Toward the Distributor The Supplier accepts and promises to the Distributor that, while the Term remains in effect, it will:

This modification redefines the relationship between the parties by shifting the primary obligation from the Distributor to the Supplier, making it clear that the Supplier has agreed to certain responsibilities during the Term of their partnership.

original: (a) use all reasonable endeavours to promote the distribution and sale of the Products; (b) not use any promotional or advertising material for the Products not approved by the Supplier, such approval not be unreasonably withheld; (c) provide Yearly non-binding sales forecasts; (d) establish and maintain documented procedures for identifying the Products with a control number for traceability and copies of those records and procedures must be made available to the Supplier within thirty (30) days of request; (e) provide regular reports on the sales activities within the Territory; (f) employ a sufficient number of suitably qualified personnel to ensure the proper fulfilment of the Distributor's obligations under this agreement; (g) maintain, on its own account, an inventory of the Products at levels which are appropriate and adequate for the Distributor to meet all customer delivery requirements for the Products throughout the Territory; (h) keep full and proper books of account and records clearly showing all enquiries, quotations, transactions and proceedings relating to the Products; (i) allow the Supplier, on reasonable notice, access to its accounts and records relating to the sale or distribution of the Products for inspection but not more than once in each year. For clarity, the Supplier will not be permitted access to any accounts or records which do not directly relate to the sale or distribution of the Products; (j) comply with any reasonable directives or instructions given by the Supplier for any promotional activities, at the suppliers cost, concerning the nature, type, quality, characteristics, fitness for purpose, suitability, use and description of the Products; 4. Supply of products 4.1 The parties acknowledge that:
ollama_generated:
(a) Strive to maximize efforts in the marketing and sales of the Products; (b) Utilize only promotional or advertising materials for the Products that have been explicitly endorsed by the Supplier, with such endorsement not being arbitrarily withheld; (c) Submit annual non-binding sales projections; (d) Develop and consistently update documented procedures for tracking the Products using a control number system. Upon request, the Distributor shall provide the Supplier access to these records and procedures within thirty (30) days; (e) Regularly report on marketing and sales activities within the Territory; (f) Maintain a workforce of qualified personnel sufficient for fulfilling the Distributor's obligations under this agreement; (g) Oversee an inventory of Products that is consistent with the Distributor's needs to meet customer delivery requirements across the Territory; (h) Maintain accurate and thorough books of account and records detailing all inquiries, quotations, transactions, and proceedings related to the Products; (i) Grant the Supplier, upon request, access to accounts and records regarding the sale or distribution of the Products for inspection, with no more than one such inspection per year. It is noted that the Supplier will not be entitled to access any accounts or records irrelevant to the sale or distribution of the Products; (j) Adhere to any reasonable directives or instructions issued by the Supplier regarding promotional activities related to the Products, at the supplier's expense, including specifying the nature, type, quality, characteristics, fitness for purpose, suitability, usage, and description of the Products.

  4. Supply of Products
   4.1 The parties acknowledge that:
       (i) The Distributor is primarily responsible for marketing, selling, and distributing the Products within the defined Territory; (ii) The Supplier reserves the right to issue guidelines or instructions for any promotional activities concerning the nature, type, quality, characteristics, fitness for purpose, suitability, use, and description of the Products. Any such directives shall be followed by the Distributor at the supplier's expense.

original: 6.3 Where any party is required by this agreement to reimburse or indemnify any other party for any cost or expense, that first party shall reimburse or indemnify the other party for the full amount of the cost or expense, including any GST on that amount, Source: FUSE MEDICAL, INC., 10-K, 3/21/2019 except to the extent that the other party is entitled to credit or repayment for that GST from any relevant tax authority.
modified:
6.3 In cases where a Party incurs costs or expenses due to this agreement's requirements, and is responsible for reimbursement or indemnification towards another Party, the initial Party shall only be liable for the net amount of the cost or expense, exclusive of any GST. Any recoverable GST should be retained by the first Party, pending potential credit or repayment from relevant tax authorities.

The change made to the clause was inverting the responsibility of GST handling from the initial party (now responsible for retaining and potentially recovering the GST) to the receiving party (no longer entitled to claim any GST recovered from tax authorities).

original: 7. Advertising and promotion 7.1 The Distributor shall:
ollama_generated:
7. Advertising and Promotion:
7.1 It is at the discretion of the Distributor whether to:

(a) Initiate advertising campaigns related to the Product; and
(b) Undertake promotional activities in connection with the Product, subject to prior written consent from the Supplier if such activities deviate significantly from the established marketing strategy.

The Distributor may choose not to advertise or promote the Product without any obligation to provide reasons for such decision. However, failure to comply with this clause may lead to consequences as outlined in Section 12.3.

original: (a) comply with all applicable laws, statutes and regulations relating to anti-bribery and anti- corruption; and (b) not engage in any activity, practice or conduct which would constitute an offence.
ollama_generated:
(a) While striving to adhere to all relevant laws, statutes, and regulations concerning anti-bribery and anti-corruption, the Party acknowledges that it may occasionally face unforeseen circumstances which could potentially lead to noncompliance. Should such an event occur, the Party shall promptly disclose the nature and extent of any noncompliance to the other Parties, cooperate in good faith to remedy the situation, and take appropriate measures to prevent recurrence.
  (b) The Party reserves the right to engage in activities, practices, or conduct that could be interpreted as an offence under specific, extraordinary circumstances, provided that such actions are deemed necessary for the legitimate exercise of its rights or performance of its obligations under this Agreement, and are consistent with the general principles of anti-bribery and anti-corruption. The Party shall, however, endeavor to minimize the potential negative impacts of such actions and, if requested by any Party, explain the justification and proportionality of such actions in writing within a reasonable timeframe.

original: 9.9 Each party shall promptly give notice in writing to the other if it becomes aware of:
ollama_generated:
9.9 It is recommended, albeit not mandatory, that a party provide written notification without undue delay to the other, should they discover:

This revised clause suggests that while giving notice remains advisable, it is no longer an obligation but a recommendation, thus weakening the force of the original provision.

original: (a) the Supplier and the Distributor shall agree:
ollama_generated:
(a) The Distributor shall have the discretion to determine, at their sole judgment, that:

The Supplier's obligations with respect to the goods supplied are solely contingent upon the Distributor's approval and acceptance of such goods. Any disagreement regarding this approval shall be resolved by the Distributor's decision being final and binding.

original: 10.2 The Distributor shall, within five days of a matter which may result in a Relevant Claim:
ollama_generated:
10.2 In the event of a situation potentially leading to a Relevant Claim, the Distributor is expected to notify us within a reasonable period of time, not exceeding five business days. However, our response time for addressing such matters shall be without prejudice and at our sole discretion.

This clause places a more flexible obligation on the Distributor regarding the timeframe for notification, while also clarifying that our response time is not guaranteed.

original: 12. Effectsof termination 12.1 Termination of this agreement for any reason shall not affect any rights or liabilities accrued at the date of termination.
modified:
12. Accrued Rights and Obligations upon Termination
  12.1 Termination of this agreement for any cause will not release either party from any obligations or claims that have already arisen prior to termination.

original: 12.4 Subject to clause 12.2, all other rights and licences of the Distributor under this agreement shall terminate on the termination date.
modified: 12.4 Pending clause 12.2, it is understood that all other rights and licenses granted to the Licensor under this agreement persist beyond the termination date, unless otherwise specified or agreed upon in writing.

original: 13. Confidentiality 13.1 Each party undertakes that it shall not at any time, disclose to any person any confidential information concerning the business, affairs, customers, clients or suppliers of the other party or of any member of the group of companies to which the other party belongs, except as provided by clause 13.2.
ollama_generated:
13. Shared Knowledge Exemption
13.1 Each party hereby acknowledges its potential access to sensitive information regarding the business, affairs, customers, clients, or suppliers of the other party, or any entity within the group of companies associated with the other party. The parties agree that they shall have no obligation to keep this information confidential and may freely disclose it to third parties, unless expressly prohibited by law or an explicit agreement between the parties.

In essence, we have moved from a strong confidentiality obligation to a situation where parties have no obligation to maintain confidentiality unless explicitly agreed upon or legally required. This shift highlights the need for parties to be mindful of their information sharing and seek explicit agreements to protect sensitive data when necessary.

original: 13.2 Each party may disclose the other party's confidential information:
ollama_generated:
13.2 Under specific circumstances necessitated by legal obligations or to protect their own interests, either party reserves the right to disclose the other party's confidential information:

Explanation: The original clause allows both parties to disclose each other's confidential information under any circumstance. In the rewritten clause, I have added a condition that the disclosure of confidential information must be necessitated by legal obligations or for the protection of their own interests. This shifts the focus from general discretion to specific circumstances and potentially makes the obligation slightly less likely to be exercised.

original: 13.3 No party shall use any other party's confidential information for any purpose other than to perform its obligations under this agreement.
ollama_generated: 13.3 Under no circumstances may a party exploit the confidential information of another for personal gain, or any purpose beyond the minimal requirements necessary to fulfill their responsibilities as outlined in this agreement. This includes but is not limited to using such information for profit-making activities or disseminating it to third parties without prior consent.

original: 14.3 Nothing in this clause shall limit or exclude any liability for fraud.
ollama_generated:
14.3 This clause does not absolve any party from their obligations when it comes to liabilities arising from acts of fraud.

In this revised version, the meaning has been slightly altered by shifting the responsibility. Now, instead of stating that no liability is limited or excluded for fraud (as in the original clause), we clarify that this clause does not exempt any party from their obligations regarding liabilities for fraudulent acts.

original: 17. Freedom to contract The parties declare that they each have the right, power and authority and have taken all action necessary to execute and deliver and to exercise their rights and perform their obligations under this agreement.
ollama_generated: 17. Right to Contract: The parties acknowledge their individual capacity to enter into this agreement, but expressly relieve each other from any liability for any claims arising from a lack of such authority or power, unless proven otherwise with clear evidence. Each party is responsible for their own actions and obligations under this contract; however, any failure to fulfill an obligation shall not be considered a breach if it results from circumstances beyond their reasonable control.

original: (a) if delivered personally, when left at the address and for the contact referred to in this clause; or (b) if sent by pre-paid first class post or recorded delivery, at 9.00 am on the second Business Day after posting; or (c) if delivered by commercial courier, on the date and at the time that the courier's delivery receipt is signed; or (d) if delivered by email, on the date and at the time such email is received by the recipient whether such message is opened at that time.
ollama_generated:
The Receiver shall consider the Delivery as complete under the following circumstances:

(a) upon personal delivery, when the Sender can provide proof of delivery to the address and contact details specified in this clause; or

(b) if sent by pre-paid first class post or recorded delivery, the Receiver will be deemed to have received the Delivery 48 hours after the posting date, provided that no notice of non-delivery has been given within that period; or

(c) if delivered by commercial courier, upon receipt of a signed confirmation of delivery from the courier service; or

(d) for email deliveries, the Receiver is considered to have received the Delivery at the exact moment it enters their inbox. However, if the Receiver provides evidence that they were unable to access their email account during this period, the timeline for receipt will be extended until such a time when they could have reasonably accessed their emails.

original: 20.3 A notice given under this agreement shall not be validly given if sent by e-mail.
ollama_generated: 20.3 A notice provided under this agreement shall only be considered valid when delivered via a physical mail service or in-person communication, excluding electronic means such as email.

original: 24. Governing law and jurisdiction 24.1 This agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with Ohio 24.2 The parties irrevocably agree that the courts of Ohio shall have non-exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with this agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non- contractual disputes or claims).
ollama_generated:
24. Governing law and Jurisdiction

24.1 This agreement, along with any disputes or claims stemming from it, related to its substance or origin, or the circumstances surrounding its creation (including non-contractual disputes), will be interpreted under and governed by the laws of Ohio.

24.2 The parties mutually consent that they may elect to bring any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this agreement or its subject matter or origin (including non-contractual disputes) before the courts of any jurisdiction within the United States, providing for the possibility of multiple venues for resolution. This does not exclude Ohio's courts from exercising their jurisdiction over such matters.
